definition: (old) rice vessel/black/old variant of 廬|庐[lu2]/(slang) (Tw) troublesome/fussy
surname Lu/abbr. for Luxembourg 盧森堡|卢森堡[Lu2 sen1 bao3]

pinyin: Hua2 tie3 lu2 huo3 che1 zhan4

sentences.english: The painter depicted Napoleon at the Battle of Waterloo.
sentences.chinese: 畫家描繪了滑鐵盧戰役中的拿破崙。

sentences.english: The building is a commemoration of the battle of Waterloo.
sentences.chinese: 這座房子是滑鐵盧戰役紀念館。

sentences.english: Mr DeMint says that health care is Mr Obama’s Waterloo.
sentences.chinese: 德銘特還認爲醫保就是奧巴馬的“滑鐵盧”。

sentences.english: The English language classes are held at the nearby Waterloo-Campus of Conestoga College.
sentences.chinese: 英語課是在滑鐵盧校園附近的康尼託嘉學院。

sentences.english: The shadow of an enormous right is projected athwart Waterloo.
sentences.chinese: 極大的右的黑影投射在滑鐵盧了。

sentences.english: At Waterloo, he was chief of a squadron of cuirassiers, in Dubois' brigade.
sentences.chinese: 滑鐵盧戰爭中，他在杜布瓦旅當鐵甲騎兵隊隊長。

sentences.english: In Waterloo, Li lived the hand-to-mouth life of a grad student.
sentences.chinese: 在滑鐵盧，他過着研究生的緊緊巴巴的日子。

sentences.english: Waterloo is a battle of the first order, won by a captain of the second.
sentences.chinese: 滑鐵盧是一場頭等戰爭，卻被一個次等的將領勝了去。

sentences.english: Wellington went to the village of Waterloo to draw up his report to Lord Bathurst.
sentences.chinese: 威靈頓回到滑鐵盧村裏寫軍書，向貴人巴塞司特報捷。

sentences.english: Waterloo bears divine right on its crupper.
So, I took a taxi to Waterloo station.
sentences.chinese: 於是我搭出租車去了滑鐵盧車站。

sentences.english: Mr. Binks: One of my ancestors fell at Waterloo.
sentences.chinese: 我的一個祖先戰敗在滑鐵盧。

sentences.english: Waterloo was where Napolean was finally defeated.
sentences.chinese: 滑鐵盧正是拿破崙被打敗的地方。

sentences.english: Let us, therefore, speak of Waterloo coldly from both sides.
sentences.chinese: 讓我們平心靜氣，從兩方面來談談滑鐵盧吧。

sentences.english: The battle of Waterloo is an enigma.
With the battlle of Waterloo， Napoleon‘s rule in Europe was ended.
sentences.chinese: 滑鐵盧一戰，拿破崙對歐洲的統治就完蛋了。

definition: tossed about by the wind and rain (idiom)/(of a situation) unstable
to surmount all difficulties (on the way to success) (idiom)/abbr. for 過五關斬六將|过五关斩六将[guo4 wu3 guan1 zhan3 liu4 jiang4]
Golden Lion, award at the Venice Film Festival
peer competition/to function as rivals/to make claims as an equal
to seize total victory (idiom); an overwhelming victory/to win by a landslide (in election)
to turn defeat into victory (idiom); to turn the tide
to break up into components/to disintegrate/to collapse/to crumble
Lien Chan (1936-), Taiwanese politician, former vice-president and chairman of Guomintang
